summary: This is a detailed household staff manual for Jeffrey Epstein's residence, outlining extensive protocols for grooming, guest relations, cleaning, maintenance, and emergency procedures. It provides a comprehensive view of the highly controlled and secretive environment maintained for Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and their guests.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr Epstein' throughout the manual. The document is designed to serve him and his guests, detailing specific preferences and protocols for staff.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Ms Maxwell' throughout the manual. Has her own specific protocols, bathroom, and desk. Staff are instructed to channel questions through her and advise her of unusual occurrences.

persons.name: David
persons.context: Mentioned once in the shopping list section as someone who, along with Ms Maxwell, will advise on additional meat, poultry, or fish to purchase.

persons.name: Estate Manager
persons.context: Staff are instructed to channel all questions and concerns through this person. The Estate Manager is also a key contact during standby duties and emergencies.

connections.description: Presented as co-residents of the property. The manual is designed to serve both of them and their guests, indicating a shared domestic and social environment.
Staff are instructed to channel all questions and concerns through the Estate Manager, who presumably reports to Maxwell and Epstein.
The Estate Manager is a key staff position responsible for managing the household for Epstein.
David is mentioned as co-advisor with Maxwell on purchasing specific food items, suggesting a collaborative or advisory role.

locations.context: The primary setting for the entire manual. Includes a master bedroom/bathroom, Ms Maxwell's bathroom, guestrooms, pool area, cabana, and kitchen.
Listed as the destination for medical emergencies.
A specific market listed on the pre-arrival shopping list for items like homemade mozzarella.
Where bed linens are taken for cleaning.
Where clothes requiring dry cleaning are taken.

keyFacts: The manual instructs staff to 'see nothing, hear nothing, say nothing, except to answer a question directed at you,' emphasizing extreme secrecy and privacy for Epstein, Maxwell, and their guests.
A specific pre-arrival checklist for the master bedroom includes: 'Gun placed in beside table drawer,' indicating the presence of a firearm in the bedroom.
The manual details a 'massage' setup, requiring 'Three large blue towels and one hand towel to be ready for massage in towel room' as part of the master bathroom preparation.

Staff protocols are highly regimented, covering everything from specific language to use ('Yes, Mr. Epstein'), grooming, answering phones, and driving etiquette, creating an environment of total control and servitude.

The document reveals extensive resources and planning dedicated to guest hospitality, including detailed shopping lists, guest pickup/drop-off procedures, and preparation of guest rooms to appear as if 'the arriving guest is the first to ever stay in the room.'
